Pictophonetic: 彥 indicates the sound; 頁 (head) conveys the meaning.

顏料 [ yán liào ]: paint; dye; pigment

heisig_chinese_memo: An erudite person using the countenance (facial expression) of their beautiful head to their advantage.  One look at it and they get what they want.
Ru_trainchinese: yán: (графема) честь, репутация; цвет; выражение лица; лицо
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: An erudite person using the countenance (facial expression) of their head to their advantage.  One look at it and they get what they want.
humanum_full_description_en:
The word " yan " in bronze inscription starts from " produce " from " face ", " produce " is sound symbol, and " face " is meaning symbol. " Surface Elephant Man" face, " Yan " and " face " synonymous, so the " color " from the word " face " (Liu Zhao). Chu characters do not start with " face " but with " color ", meaning the same.

Bronze was used as the surname. Nine years of Wei Ding: "I give up Yan Chen to two horses." It means I gave Yan Chen two horses.

The character " yan " in the Chu bamboo slips does not start from " face " but from " color ". The original meaning of " color " is complexion and complexion, so it is also a symbol of " yan ". Jian 8: "The color is dark and obscure". It means the face, the complexion is dark and dull. "The Analects. "Tab": "True color, Si Jinxin believes." "Father of the Fisherman": "Qu Yuan is free, swimming in the river pond, walking along the banks of the Yinze. The color is haggard, which is described as haggard." In ancient Chinese, "color" is the complexion and complexion.

Later, " Yan " means between the eyebrows, that is, Yintang. "Shuowen": "Yan, eyebrows are free. From Ye Yansheng. 𩕝, Yanwen." Duan Yucai changed to "eyebrows free."
humanum_short_description_en: The word for " yan " in the bronze inscription starts with " mian " (like a face), and " produces " the sound.
humanum_full_description:
金文「顏」字從「产」從「面」，「产」是聲符，「面」是意符。「面」象人的臉，「顏」與「面」同義，故「顏」字從「面」(劉釗)。楚文字不從「面」而從「色」，意同。

　　金文用作姓氏，九年衛鼎：「我舍(捨)顏陳大馬兩。」表示我給予顏陳兩匹大馬。

　　楚簡文字「顏」字不從「面」而從「色」，「色」的本義是臉色、氣色，故也是「顏」的意符，《上博楚竹書五．鬼神之明 融師有成氏》簡8：「顏色深晦」。表示面容、臉色深晦、暗昧。《論語．泰伯》：「正顏色，斯近信矣。」《楚辭．漁父》：「屈原既放，遊于江潭，行吟澤畔。顏色憔悴，形容枯槁。」古漢語「顏色」即是臉色、容色。

　　後來「顏」表示兩眉之間，即印堂。《說文》：「顏，眉目之閒也。从頁彥聲。𩕝，籒文。」段玉裁改為「眉之閒也」。
humanum_short_description: 金文「顏」字從「面」（象臉蛋），「产」聲，本義是顏面、容顏。

金文「 顏 」字從「 产 」從「 面 」，「 产 」是聲符，「 面 」是意符。「 面 」象人的臉，「 顏 」與「 面 」同義，故「 顏 」字從「 面 」(劉釗)。楚文字不從「 面 」而從「 色 」，意同。 金文用作姓氏，九年衛鼎：「我舍(捨)顏陳大馬兩。」表示我給予顏陳兩匹大馬。 楚簡文字「 顏 」字不從「 面 」而從「 色 」，「 色 」的本義是臉色、氣色，故也是「 顏 」的意符，《上博楚竹書五．鬼神之明 融師有成氏》簡8：「顏色深晦」。表示面容、臉色深晦、暗昧。《論語．泰伯》：「正顏色，斯近信矣。」《楚辭．漁父》：「屈原既放，遊于江潭，行吟澤畔。顏色憔悴，形容枯槁。」古漢語「顏色」即是臉色、容色。 後來「 顏 」表示兩眉之間，即印堂。《說文》：「顏，眉目之閒也。从頁彥聲。𩕝，籒文。」段玉裁改為「眉之閒也」。
The word " yan" in bronze inscription starts from " produce" from " face", " produce" is sound symbol, and " face" is meaning symbol. " Surface Elephant Man" face, " Yan" and " face" synonymous, so the " color" from the word " face" (Liu Zhao). Chu characters do not start with " face" but with " color", meaning the same. Bronze was used as the surname. Nine years of Wei Ding: "I give up Yan Chen to two horses." It means I gave Yan Chen two horses. The character " yan" in the Chu bamboo slips does not start from " face" but from " color". The original meaning of " color" is complexion and complexion, so it is also a symbol of " yan". Jian 8: "The color is dark and obscure". It means the face, the complexion is dark and dull. "The Analects. "Tab": "True color, Si Jinxin believes." "Father of the Fisherman": "Qu Yuan is free, swimming in the river pond, walking along the banks of the Yinze. The color is haggard, which is described as haggard." In ancient Chinese, "color" is the complexion and complexion. Later, " Yan" means between the eyebrows, that is, Yintang. "Shuowen": "Yan, eyebrows are free. From Ye Yansheng. 𩕝, Yanwen." Duan Yucai changed to "eyebrows free."

顏字的基本解释

顏
yán
同“颜”。

顏字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yán］
［《廣韻》五姦切，平删，疑。］
“颜1”的繁体字。“顏1”的新字形。
(1)额头。即眉上发下、两额角间部分。
(2)面容；脸色。
(3)指形貌。
(4)指脸皮。
(5)体面；面子。
(6)显著。
(7)指堂上或门楣上的匾额。
(8)指题字于匾额或书籍封面上。
(9)颜色；色彩。
(10)（排在）前面。参见“顔行”。
(11)古代帽子的一种。其形似古皮弁，以缣帛为之。
(12)姓。
[②]［yá］
［《集韻》宜佳切，平佳，疑。］
通“厓1”。“颜2”的繁体字。“顏2”的新字形。
水边；山边。

顏字的康熙字典解释

顏字的起名意思

[①]［yán］
["Guangyun" five traits cut, flat deleted, suspicious. ]
Traditional characters of "颜1". The new glyph of "Yan 1".
(1) Forehead. That is, the part between the eyebrows and the foreheads.
(2) Face; complexion.
(3) Refers to morphology.
(4) Refers to the face.
(5) Decent; face.
(6) Significant.
(7) Refers to the plaque on the hall or lintel.
(8) Refers to the inscription on the plaque or book cover.
(9) Color; color.
(10) (in front of). See "Yan Xing".
(11) A kind of ancient hat. Its shape resembles ancient leather, and it is made of silk.
(12) Last name.
[②]［yá］
["Ji Yun" Yi Jia cut, Ping Jia, doubt. ]
